site_name: The Queens Chapel Of The Savoy
description: T1, T2 & T3 London Plane Trees (Platanus ? hispanica), GardenProposed works:Reduce crown by approximately 2?3 metres in all aspectsReturning to previous pollard points (re-pollard)Resulting dimensions: Final height approximately 11?12 metres, maintaining previous pollard frameworkJustification:Routine cyclical maintenance of previously pollarded treesTo prevent excessive crown weight and risk of structural failureTo contain size within appropriate bounds for the garden settingTo manage light levels and leaf litter affecting surrounding areaCompliance: All works to be carried out in accordance with BS 3998:2010 ? Recommendations for Tree WorkT4 Mulberry (Morus spp.), GardenProposed works:Formative crown reduction of up to 1 metre to maintain overall balance and shapeHeight to remain unchangedCurrent height: Approx. 4 metresJustification:Light formative pruning to encourage strong branch structureMaintain ornamental form and prevent asymmetryImprove long-term health and reduce likelihood of weak limb attachmentsT5  Fig Tree (Ficus carica), GardenProposed works:Reduce height by approximately 2.5 metresReduce lateral spread by 1?2 metresCurrent height: Approx. 6?7 metresResulting dimensions: Final height approx. 4?4.5 metres, width reduced accordinglyJustification:Routine maintenance to contain size within garden spaceTo improve access and light levelsPromote healthy regrowth and fruit productionPrevent encroachment onto neighbouring boundaries or structures
